data.author: Peter Baker
data.title: Trump Tests the Boundaries of the Presidency
data.description: Even more than in his first term, President Trump has mounted a fundamental challenge to the norms and expectations of what a president can and should do.

data.author: Suhasini Raj and Atul Loke
data.title: India, a Big Source of Illegal Migration, Hopes to Navigate the Trump Storm
data.description: Fear and uncertainty are rippling through India, which sends more undocumented migrants to the United States than any other country outside Latin America.

data.title: Trump says he believes US will 'get Greenland'
data.description: The president told reporters the island's 57,000 residents "want to be with us".

data.author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Andrés R. Martínez
data.title: Trump Says He Wants Jordan and Egypt to Take in Palestinians From Gaza
data.description: President Trump said he had spoken to Jordan’s leader and planned to call Egypt’s on Sunday. Most of Gaza’s two million residents have been displaced in 15 months of fighting.

data.title: Trump says Keir Starmer doing 'very good job'
data.description: The US president tells BBC he will be speaking to the prime minister in the next 24 hours.

data.author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Andrew Duehren
data.title: ‘Here to Say Thank You’: Trump Takes Victory Lap in Las Vegas
data.description: The president reiterated a pledge to end taxes on tips, but the message was an afterthought as the president celebrated his blitz of orders in his first week in office.

data.title: Trump fires at least a dozen government watchdogs
data.description: Democrats described Trump's late-night firing of the federal agency inspectors general as an 'attack on Democracy'.

data.author: David Zucchino and Zia ur-Rehman
data.title: They Were Waiting for Flights. Then Trump Closed a Door for Afghan Allies.
data.description: An executive order has halted refugee flights for Afghans who supported the American mission in Afghanistan and had been approved to resettle in the U.S.

data.title: Riley Gaines tears into WNBA star who gave Caitlin Clark black eye for wearing anti-Trump shirt
data.description: Podcast host Riley Gaines jumped in on the backlash against WNBA player DiJonai Carrington after Carrington wore an anti-Trump shirt Friday.

data.title: Trump fires 17 government watchdogs at various federal agencies
data.description: President Donald Trump fired more than a dozen government watchdogs late Friday in a move that appears to have violated federal law requiring him to notify Congress.

data.author: Helene Cooper and Karoun Demirjian
data.title: Pete Hegseth Confirmed as Defense Secretary as Vance Breaks Tie Vote
data.description: With two G.O.P. senators opposed, Pete Hegseth, President Trump’s pick for defense secretary, can afford to lose only one more. If he is confirmed, it is likely to be by the smallest margin for that post in modern times.

data.title: What you should learn from these 4 major challenges Trump overcame to win back the White House
data.description: Now that President Donald J. Trump has returned to the White House, what valuable insights can we take from his unprecedented political journey to improve our own lives?

data.title: Why Trump's holding weekend rally in Las Vegas less than a week into new admin
data.description: President Trump is back in Las Vegas this weekend, to say thank you to Nevada voters for his November election victory in the key battleground state and to give details on his push to exempt tips from federal taxes.

data.author: Brett Anderson, Tejal Rao and Korsha Wilson
data.title: As Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Looms, Restaurants’ Undocumented Workers Fear the Worst
data.description: In Los Angeles, Chicago, Washington and other cities, chefs and owners are worried for their workers and their businesses.

data.author: Michael D. Shear
data.title: How Trump Shifted Policy in Week 1, on Immigration, DEI and More
data.description: Through a flurry of orders, the new president quickly began driving the country in a different direction on many contentious issues.

data.author: Lisa Friedman, Hiroko Tabuchi and Coral Davenport
data.title: Trump Stocks E.P.A. With Oil, Gas and Chemical Lobbyists
data.description: Top political appointees are already at the E.P.A. preparing to erase the agency’s climate rules and pollution controls. Many of them have tried it before.

data.author: David Yaffe-Bellany and Eric Lipton
data.title: Trump’s Crypto Venture Divides the Industry He Aims to Support
data.description: The president’s promotion of a speculative digital coin left some crypto investors feeling blindsided, while others saw it as a gimmick that undermined the industry’s credibility.

data.author: Adam Satariano, Paul Mozur, Aaron Krolik and David McCabe
data.title: The Surveillance Tools That Could Power Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
data.description: Border enforcement agencies have spent billions assembling surveillance tools to track and find people. These could be critical in President Trump’s immigration agenda.

data.author: Maggie Haberman and Annie Karni
data.title: Trump Fires 17 Inspectors General in Late-Night Purge
data.description: The internal government watchdogs were believed to have been dismissed at several major agencies, though the Justice Department’s was not said to have been among them.

data.author: Annie Karni and Chris Cameron
data.title: Hegseth Is Second Cabinet Secretary to Need Tiebreaker Vote, After DeVos
data.description: In 2017, Betsy DeVos barely survived her confirmation vote to become President Trump’s secretary of education.

data.author: Chris Cameron
data.title: In Visit to Pacific Palisades, Trump Praises Firefighters and Blames Democratic Officials
data.description: After a tour of areas damaged by the California wildfires, the president sparred with local leaders and blamed them for a wide variety of issues affecting the disaster response.

data.title: Almost everything Trump did in his whirlwind first week
data.description: The new president promised to make heads spin on day one. The BBC’s Analysis Editor Ros Atkins tries to keep up with what just happened.

data.author: Hamed Aleaziz
data.title: Trump Officials Pause Programs to Let In Immigrants, Including Ukrainians
data.description: The pause on several initiatives that allowed immigrants to enter the country temporarily will block the entrance of people fleeing some of the most unstable and desperate places in the world.

data.title: These 9 influential podcasts helped swing the election to Trump: Report
data.description: Bloomberg released a long-form article covering the importance of right-leaning podcasters and influencers in helping swing the election to President Donald Trump.

data.author: Adam Nagourney
data.title: Trump and Newsom Promise to Work Together on California Wildfire Relief
data.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom told the president that California needed his help, and President Trump said he would work to “get something completed.”

data.author: Robinson Meyer
data.title: Trump’s Energy Policy is Full of Contradictions — on Purpose
data.description: His executive orders ultimately seek to make the market for oil and gas as big as possible.

data.author: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
data.title: Trump Reinstates Longstanding Republican Anti-Abortion Policy
data.description: The move came after he addressed thousands of abortion opponents in Washington to mark the 52nd anniversary of the Supreme Court’s 1973 decision in Roe v. Wade.

data.author: Jess Bidgood and Charlie Savage
data.title: How Trump’s Second Term Is Already Different From His First
data.description: The new president’s advisers have become masters of the government bureaucracy they have promised to upend.

data.title: Anti-abortion activists demand more than just pardons from Trump
data.description: "I think he is a horrible president when it comes to abortion," says one man who Trump pardoned yesterday.

data.author: Lisa Friedman
data.title: Trump’s Interior Department Says Gulf of Mexico Is Now ‘Gulf of America’
data.description: Trump also renamed Denali, North America’s tallest peak, as Mount McKinley, despite objections from Alaska’s senators.

data.author: Annie Correal
data.title: Honduras Says Trump’s Deportation Plan Could Push It Closer to China
data.description: Many Latin American countries are trying to distance themselves from Beijing. But in response to President Trump’s sweeping deportation plans, Honduras is doing the opposite.

data.author: Alan Feuer
data.title: Trump’s New U.S. Attorney in D.C. Comes to Aid of Oath Keepers Leader
data.description: Ed Martin, a longtime advocate for Jan. 6 defendants recently named to run the prosecutors’ office, sought to undo a judge’s order barring Stewart Rhodes from visiting Washington.

data.author: Adeel Hassan
data.title: What Is the H-1B Visa Program and Why Are Trump Backers Feuding Over It?
data.description: A debate over the program for skilled foreign workers has pitted immigration hard-liners against some of President Trump’s most influential supporters in the tech industry.

data.author: Jeanna Smialek, Theodore Tae, Christina Shaman and Claire Hogan
data.title: What Stood Out in Trump’s Speech to Davos
data.description: During his campaign, Donald J. Trump vowed to end the Ukraine war by Day 1 of his new term as president. Jeanna Smialek, the Brussels bureau chief for The New York Times, looks at how he described the war in an appearance at the World Economic Forum since taking office.

data.author: Karoun Demirjian
data.title: Senate to Vote on Pete Hegseth’s Confirmation, With Outcome Uncertain
data.description: With two G.O.P. senators opposed, Pete Hegseth, President Trump’s pick for defense secretary, can afford to lose only one more. If he is confirmed, it is likely to be by the smallest margin for that post in modern times.

data.author: Apoorva Mandavilli
data.title: Trump Pauses Disbursements to Program Supplying H.I.V. Treatment Worldwide
data.description: Pepfar, which is estimated to have delivered lifesaving treatment as many as 25 million people in 54 countries, faces a funding delay of as long as 180 days.

data.author: David Gelles, Claire Hogan and Christina Shaman
data.title: What Is the Future of the Paris Agreement?
data.description: On President Trump’s first day in office, he pulled out of the Paris Agreement, a pact among nearly all nations to fight climate change. Reporting from Davos, Switzerland, David Gelles, a climate journalist for The New York Times, explains what this decision means for the rest of the world.

data.author: Luke Broadwater and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
data.title: Trump Supports the Police, Just as Long as They Support Him
data.description: President Trump’s flurry of pardons this week sent a message to law enforcement: He will “back the blue” if they back him.

data.author: Brendan Ballou
data.title: I Prosecuted the Capitol Rioters. I Know Why Trump Pardoned Them.
data.description: Trump’s pardons will encourage more violence.

data.title: Newsom-Trump war of words still simmering as president arrives in California to survey wildfires
data.description: There's been no let-up in the war of words between President Donald Trump and California Gov. Gavin Newsom as Trump arrives in Los Angeles to survey damage from the horrific wildfires

data.author: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
data.title: Pence Wages Lonely Crusade Against Kennedy as Abortion Opponents Avoid Fight
data.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who has taken different positions on the issue, has pledged to promote President Trump’s anti-abortion agenda in a bid to get confirmed as health secretary.

data.title: Sensing Political Support, Abortion Opponents Raise Ambitions
data.description: The March for Life on Friday brought together a movement invigorated by some early moves of the second Trump administration.

data.author: Charlie Savage
data.title: Independent Watchdog, in Trump’s Cross Hairs, Scrutinizes Terrorism Watch List
data.description: The Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board, which the White House has threatened to purge, called for new limits on the list in a report issued on Friday.

data.author: Sapna Maheshwari, Aaron Krolik and Tripp Mickle
data.title: TikTok Ban and Trump Executive Order Lead to Tech Company Dilemma
data.description: The federal law banning TikTok has revealed a major schism among American tech companies: Some are willing to flout the law — and some, including Apple and Google, are not.

data.author: Ana Swanson and Maureen Farrell
data.title: Howard Lutnick, Trump’s Commerce Nominee, Discloses Business Interests
data.description: Howard Lutnick disclosed details of complex financial interests, including at least $800 million in assets and positions in more than 800 companies.

data.author: Annie Karni
data.title: Adam Schiff, Trump’s Favorite Foil, Tries to Insulate California From His Wrath
data.description: As a congressman who led the first impeachment of President Trump, Mr. Schiff relished his role in the resistance. Now a senator, he must protect his state’s interests at a perilous time.

data.author: Vjosa Isai
data.title: In Response to Trump Tariff Threat, Ontario Premier Calls an Early Election
data.description: Doug Ford, Ontario’s Conservative leader, has recently said that President Trump was “going to try to devastate our country” with a plan to impose tariffs on Canadian exports.

data.author: Zachary Small
data.title: Trump Executive Order Prompts National Gallery to End Diversity Programs
data.description: The National Gallery of Art said it had closed its office of belonging and inclusion to comply with a presidential order.

data.author: Anton Troianovski
data.title: Putin Dismisses Trump’s Sanctions Threat and Repeats His Stolen Election Claim
data.description: Russia’s president flattered his American counterpart as “smart” and “pragmatic,” and repeated Mr. Trump’s baseless claim that the 2020 election was stolen.

data.author: Christopher Flavelle
data.title: Trump Says States Should Manage Disasters. Former FEMA Leaders Agree.
data.description: “I’d rather see the states take care of their own problems,” the president said. Federal emergency managers from both parties have made the same argument.

data.author: Alan Rappeport and Colby Smith
data.title: Trump’s Inflation Fix Centers on Energy Emergency That Doesn’t Exist
data.description: Economists and analysts aren’t convinced that an expansion of oil and gas production will lower consumer prices.

data.title: Trump DHS makes key move against migrants allowed in via controversial Biden parole programs
data.description: The Department of Homeland Security is opening the door to the parole status of migrants to be reviewed, leading to their eventual removal from the country.

data.author: Jeff Sommer
data.title: How to Invest During a Presidency With a Deep Devotion to Profits
data.description: Big business has an inside track in the second Trump presidency, and people with a stake in those businesses have reason to rejoice, our columnist writes.

data.author: Reid J. Epstein
data.title: Trump Leaves Democrats Dazed, With Some Willing to Work With Republicans
data.description: Locked out of power in Washington, the party is struggling to agree on a unified message of opposition. Some of its lawmakers are even telling Republicans they want to work together.

data.author: Jesus Jiménez
data.title: Trump Expected to Visit Los Angeles on Friday
data.description: Ahead of his trip, the president threatened to withhold aid from California, which he said had mismanaged its water during firefighting efforts.

data.title: New fires erupt in southern California ahead of Trump visit
data.description: The blazes - named Laguna, Sepulveda, Gibbel, Gilman and Border 2 - flared up on Thursday in Los Angeles, San Diego, Ventura and Riverside.

data.author: Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Rachel Cohn, Whitney Jones, Rachel Dry, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano, Rowan Niemisto and Diane Wong
data.title: Quantum TikTok + Memecoin Mania + Chris Hayes on the Attention Wars
data.description: “We are starting to see how Silicon Valley wants to do business during the Trump administration.”

data.author: Tracy Mumford, David Yaffe-Bellany, Sopan Deb, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart and Jessica Metzger
data.title: Trump’s First Presidential Trip, and an American Egg Crisis
data.description: Plus, how Kidz Bop grew up.

data.title: Fox News Digital's News Quiz: January 24, 2025
data.description: A music mishap did not phase this singer at President Donald Trump's inauguration; an Israeli leader calls it quits. Try your hand at Fox News Digital's News Quiz.

data.author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
data.title: Trump to Visit North Carolina and California, With Disaster Aid an Open Question
data.description: While he has expressed support for North Carolina residents, the president has criticized California’s Democratic leaders and threatened to withhold federal aid from the state.

data.author: Choe Sang-Hun
data.title: Trump Says He Will Reach Out to North Korean Leader Kim Jong-un
data.description: North Korea’s leader has grown more assertive since their last efforts at diplomacy ended in failure — and now has Russia at his side.

data.author: Adam Nagourney
data.title: From Fires to Mudslides, Catastrophe Has Defined Newsom’s Tenure
data.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom faces what may be his greatest political test and leadership challenge. He planned to greet President Trump upon his arrival in Southern California on Friday.

data.author: Christopher Flavelle
data.title: Trump Says States Should Manage Disasters. Former FEMA Leaders Agree.
data.description: “I’d rather see the states take care of their own problems,” the president said. Federal emergency managers from both parties have made the same argument.

data.author: Austyn Gaffney and Mira Rojanasakul
data.title: Trump Said, ‘We Have More Coal Than Anybody.’ See Where We Burn It.
data.description: There are 206 coal-burning power plants left in the United States, which supply about 16 percent of the country’s energy. Experts say burning more doesn’t make financial sense.

data.author: Trish Bendix
data.title: Jimmy Kimmel Mocks Trump Ahead of His L.A. Visit
data.description: The comedian, who is based in Los Angeles, said that President Trump was visiting California on Friday “to blame us for the fires in person.”

data.author: Hamed Aleaziz
data.title: Trump Officials Move to Quickly Expel Migrants Biden Allowed In Temporarily
data.description: A memo appears to allow Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers to target programs that let in more than a million people.

data.author: Heather Knight, Catrin Einhorn and Christina Morales
data.title: In California Fires, Trump Blames Newsom for Withholding Water. Experts Disagree.
data.description: President Trump has blamed a lack of water during the Los Angeles fires on California decisions that benefit a small fish. Yet experts say he’s confusing different issues.

data.author: Chris Cameron
data.title: Trump Pardons Anti-Abortion Activists Who Blockaded Clinic
data.description: The move came ahead of the March for Life, the annual anti-abortion rally in Washington where Vice President JD Vance is expected to address attendees.

data.author: Shaila Dewan and Amy Harmon
data.title: Trump Bars Transgender Women From U.S. Prisons for Female Inmates
data.description: In an executive order, the president also moved to end gender-related medical treatments for transgender people in prison.

data.title: Trump orders release of JFK assassination documents
data.description: Unanswered questions and conspiracy theories have long dogged the assassinations, particularly the murder of President John F Kennedy.

data.title: Defense Department pauses all social media posts pending review by incoming secretary
data.description: In the future, all social media posts from the Department of Defense will reflect an emphasis solely on "warfighting and lethality" under President Donald Trump, Fox News has learned.

data.author: Peter Baker
data.title: Trump Vows to Release Records on Kennedy and King Killings
data.description: President Trump told security agencies to develop plans to make public all documents related to the assassinations of John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

data.author: David Yaffe-Bellany
data.title: Trump Issues Executive Order to Boost Cryptocurrency Industry
data.description: The order signaled that the president intends to promote an industry that faced scrutiny during the Biden administration — and that he has a personal stake in.

data.author: Jason DeParle
data.title: Trump Drive to Cut Safety Net Could Hit His Voters
data.description: The new administration wants to slash aid for health, food and housing, but many of those programs now reach the struggling working class he is courting.

data.author: Alan Feuer and Dmitriy Khavin
data.title: Violent Acts of Many Jan. 6 Rioters Pardoned by Trump Are Shown in Videos
data.description: President Trump pardoned men who violently attacked police officers on Jan. 6 along with nearly 1,600 other people who had been charged in connection with the riot. But his grant of clemency did not erase the video evidence of their crimes.

data.author: Helene Cooper
data.title: Trump Pulls the Military Back Into the Political and Culture Wars
data.description: The removal of a portrait of Gen. Mark A. Milley, the former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, from a Pentagon hallway was among the president’s early actions.

data.author: Emmett Lindner
data.title: Friday Briefing: Trump Criticizes Europe
data.description: Plus, the Oscar nominations.

data.title: US doesn't need Canadian energy or cars, says Trump
data.description: Speaking to business leaders in Davos, Trump also repeated his jibe that Canada could become a US state and would avoid tariffs if it did.

data.author: Charlie Savage, Adam Goldman and Alan Feuer
data.title: Kash Patel, Trump’s F.B.I. Pick, Pushed False Claims About Trump Investigations
data.description: Kash Patel, Donald J. Trump’s choice to run the bureau, has made a series of spurious assertions about the Russia, Jan. 6 and classified documents inquiries.

data.title: Judge blocks Trump's plan to end US birthright citizenship
data.description: During a hearing, Judge John Coughenour called Trump's citizenship order "blatantly unconstitutional".

data.author: Jim Tankersley, Emma Bubola, Andrew Higgins and Aurelien Breeden
data.title: Trump Is Leading a Global Surge to the Right
data.description: But not all of the leading conservative populist parties in the world are the same — in rhetoric or on policy.

data.author: Campbell Robertson and Erica L. Green
data.title: Tell Us How It Feels to Be a Federal Employee Right Now
data.description: We want to know what you think about the changes President Trump is making to federal government jobs. How are the administration’s new policies going to affect you and your work?

data.author: Mike Baker and Mattathias Schwartz
data.title: Judge Blocks Trump’s Plan to End Birthright Citizenship
data.description: A federal judge in Seattle has issued a temporary order halting the president’s plan.

data.author: Annie Karni
data.title: ‘A Bounty on My Head’: Congress’s First Transgender Member Faces the Trump Era
data.description: Representative Sarah McBride did not run for Congress emphasizing L.G.B.T.Q. issues. But since her arrival in Washington, her identity has come under attack from newly empowered Republicans.

data.title: 'A mockery': Trump's new meme-coin sparks anger in crypto world
data.description: The president's meme-coin launch is being criticised as a stunt, while impatience grows for deregulation.

data.author: Ismaeel Naar
data.title: Trump Re-Labels Yemen’s Houthi Rebels as Terrorists
data.description: The move will authorize harsher penalties on the Iran-backed group, which has attacked Israel and disrupted global shipping trade in the Red Sea for over a year.

data.author: Shawn McCreesh
data.title: Trump Revels in a Presidential Perk: The Omnipresent Press Pool
data.description: His volubility in his first few days back in office underscores that President Trump is in charge of his own show.

data.author: Kyle Buchanan
data.title: Oscar Snubs and Surprises: Daniel Craig Misses; Fernanda Torres Scores
data.description: Sebastian Stan’s Trump portrayal is also rewarded after the film had a hard time getting distribution, while Marianne Jean-Baptiste was overlooked.

data.author: Glenn Thrush
data.title: Justice Dept. Cancels Entry-Level Job Offers in Honors Program
data.description: The program, which has functioned quietly for decades, is the latest target of Trump administration appointees who are eager to exert more control over who gets government jobs.

data.title: Mayors, local officials could face arrest if they don't comply with Trump's mass deportations
data.description: Homeland security advisor Stephen Miller warned left-wing local leaders who try to shield illegal immigrants from deportation could face arrest during 'Jesse Watters Primetime.'

data.author: Bret Stephens
data.title: What It Means That No Republican Is Acting on the Pete Hegseth Allegations
data.description: Party loyalty remains strong even for nominees who go down. Pete Hegseth’s no different, but the Trump era has strengthened it even more.

data.author: Linda Qiu
data.title: Trump’s Agriculture Pick to Face Questioning from Lawmakers
data.description: Brooke Rollins, the president’s nominee to lead the Agriculture Department, will appear before the Senate agriculture committee on Thursday.

data.title: David Axelrod questions Biden's masculinity after last-second family pardons: 'Man up'
data.description: Former Obama aide David Axelrod lashed out at former President Biden for issuing preemptive pardons for his family members minutes before President Trump was sworn in.

data.author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Edmund Lee
data.title: Trump Escalates His War on D.E.I.
data.description: President Trump’s campaign to end diversity, equity and inclusion policies has begun in federal agencies, and is jolting corporate America as well.

data.title: Trump re-designates Houthis as Foreign Terrorist Organisation
data.description: The move reverses President Biden's decision to remove the group from the US' terror list.

data.author: Emma Goldberg
data.title: Trump’s D.E.I. Order Causes ‘Chaos’ Among Corporate Leaders
data.description: The executive order signals that private businesses and organizations could be investigated over their diversity policies.

data.author: Benjamin Mullin
data.title: CNN Cuts Jobs and Shuffles TV Lineup as It Enters New Trump Era
data.description: Mark Thompson has promised to reinvent CNN since he arrived in 2023. Now, he is remaking the network’s TV lineup and its work force.

data.title: NEWT GINGRICH: 5 ways President Trump has introduced a revolutionary rejection of the old order
data.description: The amazing thing about President Trump’s revolutionary rejection of the old order was that it occurred in five different areas. It was decisive in each.

data.author: Catie Edmondson and Andrew Duehren
data.title: What Republicans Could Cut to Pay for Trump’s Tax Cuts: Medicaid and More
data.description: President Trump wants a massive tax cut and immigration crackdown bill. Now Republicans must decide what to cut to help pay for it.

data.title: Trump's 'shock and awe': Forget first 100 days, new president shows off frenetic pace in first 100 hours
data.description: Donald Trump is back in the White House and moving at warp speed. New presidents traditionally aim for a bevy of action and accomplishments in their first 100 days. He's pushing to pull it off in his first 100 hours
